contentrichtext.text: {{infobox UK place | country = England | latitude = 52.65518 | longitude = 0.965425 | os_grid_reference = TG005105 | official_name = Yaxham | population = 677 | population_ref = ([[United Kingdom Census 2001|2001 census]]<ref name="2001census">[http://www.norfolk.gov.uk/consumption/groups/public/documents/general_resources/ncc017867.xls Census population and household counts for unparished urban areas and all parishes]. Office for National Statistics & Norfolk County Council (2001). Retrieved 20 June 2009.</ref>) | area_total_km2 = 6.64 | static_image = [[Image:Yaxham-g2.jpg|240px]] | static_image_caption = Yaxham St. Peter | shire_district = [[Breckland (district)|Breckland]] | shire_county = [[Norfolk]] | region = East of England | civil_parish = Yaxham | constituency_westminster = | postcode_district = NR19 | postcode_area = NR | post_town = DEREHAM | dial_code = | london_distance = | website = http://www.yaxham-village.co.uk/index.jsp }} '''Yaxham''' is a [[village]] and [[civil parish]] in centre of the [[English county]] of [[Norfolk]]. The parish includes the village of Yaxham, together with the neighbouring community of '''Clint Green'''. Together, they lay some {{convert|2|mi}} south of [[Dereham]] and {{convert|20|mi}} west of [[Norwich]].<ref>Ordnance Survey (1999). ''OS Explorer Map 238 - East Dereham & Aylsham''. ISBN 0-319-21869-4.</ref> The civil parish has an area of {{convert|6.64|km2|abbr=on}} and in the [[United Kingdom Census 2001|2001 census]] had a population of 677 in 290 households. For the purposes of local government, the parish falls within the [[Non-metropolitan district|district]] of [[Breckland (district)|Breckland]].<ref name="2001census" /> Yaxham Mill is the local pub. There are several other holiday cottages for rent in and around the village as well as a range of small businesses, covering Complementary Therapies, IT, Photography, Podiatry, Public Relations and Social Housing. "Yaxham St. Peter" is one of 124 existing [[round-tower church]]es in [[Norfolk]]. There is an Evangelical Congregational church in Clint Green. The Village is home to Yaxham CE VA Primary School. [[Yaxham railway station]] in the village is on the [[Mid-Norfolk Railway]], a [[heritage railway]] running between the historic market towns of [[Wymondham]] and [[Dereham]]. The [[Yaxham Light Railway]] can also be found adjacent to the railway station. Yaxham has excellent facilities for its residents including a postbox and two bus stops. ==See also== *[[HMS Yaxham]], a [[Ham class minesweeper]] == Notes == {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Yaxham}} {{oscoor gbx|TG005105}}. *{{OS coord|TG022109_region:GB_scale:100000|Map sources}} for Clint Green *[http://www.yaxham-village.co.uk/ Yaxham Village Website] *[http://www.origins.org.uk/genuki/NFK/places/y/yaxham/ Information from Genuki Norfolk] on Yaxham. *[http://www.roundtowerchurches.de/Karte/C4/Yaxham_St_Peter/yaxham_st_peter.html Website with photos of Yaxham St. Peter], a [[round-tower church]] *[http://www.yaxham-light-railway.fsnet.co.uk/ Yaxham light railway] *[http://www.lhi.org.uk/projects_directory/projects_by_region/east_of_england/norfolk/yaxham_st_peters_pcc/ Yaxham Heritage Initiative] {{Civil Parishes of Breckland}} [[Category:Villages in Norfolk]] [[Category:Breckland]] [[Category:Civil parishes in Norfolk]]
